head.supplied: ¶ The utilitarian plants " ¶ suitable for these colonies ¶ " are mentioned in the bye-following volume, ¶ which probably will afford to his Worship the Mayor of Launceston all the information desire...

div.p: N89/1585, unit 407, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
MS is a file note. On 1 February 1889 David Scott, Mayor of Launceston, Tas., wrote to the Chief Secretary asking for a 'list of the Botanical Specimens in the Botanical Gardens Melbourne' for the use of their Gardener. The Under Secretary, T. Wilson, referred the letter to M 'for report. I am not very clear as to what it is the writer is asking for.' Scott's request was also referred to W. Guilfoyle, Curator, Botanic Gardens (N89/2159, unit 407, VPRS 3992/P, PROV). The note, above, was M's reply to Wilson's memo.
The utilitarian plants " suitable for these colonies " are mentioned in the bye-following volume,
cite what it probably was.
which probably will afford to his Worship the Mayor of Launceston all the information desired there.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
